intro: Aegopogon imperfectus, commonly known as the lesser thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. Aegopogon imperfectus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
